brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of a meal containing different doses
      of L-arabinose, on the intestinal sucrase activity after intake We measure this by measuring
      the glucose, insulin and c-peptide after meals. Other measurements are made (glucagon and
      GLP-1) to explain the correlations.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of L-arabinose in a Meal in Healthy Men

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male

          -  normal weight (BMI 18,5-25 kg/m2)

          -  18-30 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Not healthy,including those with diabetes Mellitus, high bloodpressure, dyslipidemia
             or a infectious diseases (hepatitis or HIV), gastrointestinal disorders

          -  Central adipositas (defined as waist circumference > 94 cm for european men)

          -  Daily intake of vitamins and minerals, 3 months before the trail starts and during
             the trail.

          -  elevated alcoholcunsumption(> 21 units af alcohol pr. week)

          -  take medicine

          -  Elite athlete with intensive training

          -  given bloddonation within the last 3 months

          -  smoking

intervention.description: L-arabinose is mixed into the dough of the buns and cup cakes

clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of L-arabinose in a Meal on Glucose Metabolism in Healthy Men

overall_official.affiliation: Unit of Nutrition 5711, Rigshospitalet, Blegdamsvej 9, 2100 København Ø
